name: 2D Navier-Stokes Regularity
description: Prove regularity (existence and uniqueness of smooth solutions) for 2D incompressible Navier-Stokes equations.
source: Millennium Prize Problems (related but not identical)

insights: Mathlib lacks PDE infrastructure: no dedicated PDE theory, wave/heat equation, or general nonlinear PDE framework
Sobolev spaces were only recently formalized (2024) via Gagliardo-Nirenberg-Sobolev inequality, limited to compact domains
Tempered distributions formalized October 2025 - first in any proof assistant - but general distribution theory still missing
LeanDojo project formalizes Navier-Stokes problem STATEMENT only, not any solution theory
Weak solution framework requires: general distribution theory, unbounded domain Sobolev spaces, Aubin-Lions compactness (not formalized)
2D regularity is easier than 3D but still requires full weak solution machinery
Energy estimates, Galerkin approximations, monotone operator theory all missing from Mathlib
